Grants and Development Funds are available to clubs who can demonstrate a commitment to developing sporting opportunities for young people.

Terms and Conditions

  • The Grant will be used solely towards financing the items as set out in the approved application and under no circumstances will it be used for any other purpose.
  • Prior to commencement of work/purchase, at least three competitive tenders/quotes must be provided for items whose total cost exceeds enter amount
  • A full explanation must be submitted to the Head of Recreation if it is your intention not to accept the lowest tender.
  • Your Club must indicate how you intend to acknowledge the support of the Council.
  • The Club agrees to participate in reasonable requests to assist publicity/promotional activities regarding this grant.
  • Any representative authorised by the Council will be allowed to inspect the Facility/Project at any time.
  • The Club shall keep proper accounts and records regarding the project and permit the Council access to them.
  • The Club shall keep the Facility/Equipment in good repair and undertake all things as may be necessary to ensure its proper maintenance.
  • The Club to return the attached written agreement to the conditions of the grant.
  • The Club to provide receipted invoice for work carried out/goods supplied.
  • The Council reserves the right to reclaim all or part of the grant if the above conditions are not complied with.
  • An offer of grant remains valid for a period of one year from the date of the Panel at which the award is made. If a Club is unable to make a valid claim within this period, the award is forfeited.
